result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen Edward Herrmann

records.addlTxt:
2:30 PM Defendant Allen Edward Herrmann in court.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for Allen Edward Herrmann and State of Wisconsin. CH - Clerk State requests to reschedule as DE does not have counsel. DE wishes to waive time limits. CT. finds good cause to extend time limits. CT. DE to be in contact with SPD weekly re counsel. CT. If DE has not been appt counsel 2 days before next scheduled hearing, hearing to be converted to status. Bond cont. 2:40 pm adj.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on November 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Absolute Sobriety. Not to possess or consume alcohol.  Not to possess or consume controlled substances without a prescription and only in amount/frequency as prescribed. Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Comply with any mental health regimen. Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. No to be on the premises 5J's Bar located at 418 4th Street, Centuria, WI or Pub 35 located at 2378 WI-35, Milltown, WI. No contact with CJC.  No contact with the following individuals outside of their professional capacities: Deputy Ben Hall, Deputy Dean McManus, Officer Patrick Mariakis, Officer Tanner Rebhan.

1:05 PM. JL-Clerk.  Prosecuting attorney David Stilin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Donna Burger appeared by video for Allen Edward Herrmann. Defendant Allen Edward Herrmann appeared by video, in custody. Qualifies. State req $2500 cash bond. CT sets bond.   DSPH. 1:20 pm adj.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
